text: to practice our dancing he can't know I
know hey Scott and I met right after the
new year in 2009 we both went to a
poetry reading hosted by mutual friends
at the bowery poetry club and afterwards
we were all getting together we were
going to go get some food and I saw him
out on the sidewalk she was wearing this
white winter cap that she has stolen
where's me whenever it gets cold and she
was talking to this guy and I thought
that I was I just assume that she was
his girlfriend so I just sort of tried
not to stare when we got to the bar
that's when I really noticed him and we
started talking he was laughing at all
my jokes um and we really hit it off and
we spent the whole night talking to each
other I don't remember exactly what we
first said but I remember making a lot
of jokes with her I think we closed down
the bar so we went outside and I think
it was must have been two or three in
the morning and I asked him if he wanted
to get a coffee with me and he said yeah
that's exactly what i want to do i which
i thought was rare so we went to dunkin
donuts and we each got a black coffee I
mean we didn't really want to sit and
linger and dunkin donuts so we got on
the train and we went back to my place
and bed-stuy and stayed up really late
that that night talking i was on
vacation and so was he and so neither of
us had any place to be so i think i
spent two days very innocent days at his
apartment in bed-stuy and he made me
breakfast and dinner and I think he
thought maybe I was moving in really
from from the first night it was
something it was something really
special it was him it wasn't like I
don't know I wasn't like taking taking
somebody taking somebody back to my to
my place or something even though that's
how
that's how with that's how it sounds now
yeah i think it was love at first sight
we got engaged after three weeks of
knowing each other I gave a poetry
reading that night he read beautifully
it was a very celebratory sort of
special a special night and we
celebrated a little with some friends
and then we came back to my apartment
and I said you know i love you i love
you so much i love it i want to be with
you every day let's get married yeah
yeah like it was sort of a sort of a
like I discovered halfway through saying
this that yeah that's what that's what
that's what people do when they were
they when I feel like this and I said I
want to spend the rest of my life with
you I I want to marry you and so we sort
of got we were engaged and he didn't
have a rig he thought that that was very
important so he made a ring for me out
of blue masking tape and he sketched a
little hard on it it was so
unpremeditated but I I'm really glad I
did it
